Explosions were heard from Sumy City.
Another Iskander to Sumy Oblast, flying in the same direction.
4th Iskander to Sumy Oblast
5th Iskander to Sumy Oblast. All flew one after another towards Lebedyn.
The Iskanders seem to be impacting in this general area.
Zelensky has arrived in Washington ahead of his meeting with Trump.
Kryvyi Rih, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, is being attacked by Russian Geran-2 drones. ~19 drones are involved, and several impacts have been recorded.

Can you see this message?
edit: Some of my posts aren't going through, not sure why.
POV: Western MSM every single time Kryvyi Rih gets attacked.
Both Iskanders seem to have impacted in/near the village of Martove, Kharkiv Oblast.

Footage showing the two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes that targeted the village of Martove, Kharkiv Oblast, last night. They reportedly targeted a Ukrainian preparation site for launching long-range UAVs. 
Coordinates: 49.95638, 36.96833

Russian forces have captured the village of Poltavka, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~1,110.
Total land area: ~6.49 km¬≤.

Ukrainian UAVs are flying to Crimea for a large attack. Groups are flying towards Yevpatoriya on the western coast of Crimea, and Saki on the southern coast. More are flying in from off the coast of southern Kherson Oblast.

During the Ukrainian UAV attack on Crimea today, a Russian Su-30SM fighter involved in air defence operations crashed after it was hit by friendly fire. Russian VKS-affiliated channel Fighterbomber confirmed the reports, stating that the crew survived and is safe.

A short time ago, Russian long-range Smerch MLRS targeted the Peresadivka area of Mykolaiv Oblast, around 64 km from the nearest Russian-controlled territory. Explosions were heard in the area. A Russian reconnaissance drone was operating there at the time.

Ukrainian drones from the "Lasar" drone group of the National Guard hit and destroyed the Russian BM-30 Smerch launcher that targeted Peresadivka, Mykolaiv Oblast last night. 
A reconnaissance drone monitored the launches of Smerch rockets, before relaying the coordinates of its relocated position to drone crews who subsequently struck it. 
Coordinates: 46.325527, 32.735003 (~30 km from the frontline).
KAB glide-bomb to Sumy City.
KAB glide-bomb to Sumy City.
Explosion in Sumy

Recently, the situation east of Kostyantynivka has become very mixed and complicated as Russian forces attempt to consolidate outside the city and begin entering the more built-up area.
As a result, I have decided to add a very large grey zone, where Russian and Ukrainian positions are mixed and layered, often operationally encircling each other. This map below shows areas where Russian and Ukrainian soldiers have been recorded, although this doesn't necessarily show consolidation. In the future, once the situation clears up and one side clearly regains the initiative, the map will be updated to show additional control zones. But for now, it will look something like this.
This has happened due to the large open areas here, with limited cover from treelines and individual, isolated buildings. Additionally, Ukraine's manpower shortages have forced them to resort to increased drone usage. Kostyantynivka provides practically endless hiding spots for drone operators, while Russia has Chasiv Yar and the surrounding forests and villages to use for this. Both Russian and Ukrainian soldiers are operating in small assault groups of usually 2-4 people, clearing each other out of their positions. A similar situation was observed (and still is to some extent) in the Dobropillya direction.
Meanwhile, extensive preparatory bombing and shelling continues on Kostyantynivka, primarily targeting its eastern districts, ahead of the Russian storming operation on the city.

In the Hulyaipole direction, Russian forces continued to advance over the last week, and have captured the rest of Poltavka.
After crossing the Yanchur River and securing a bridgehead on its western bank, Russian forces pushed further under heavy drone and artillery cover, expanding their zone of control to the northern outskirts of Poltavka. Other forces advanced south, linking up with the formations north of Malynivka. 
Additionally, the Russians improved their positions north of Malynivka, capturing the rest of the forests there and beginning a push west of Poltavka. However, the arrival of Ukrainian reinforcements has slowed their advance, and counterattacks will likely begin in the near future. 
+ ~4.55 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Pokrovske direction, Russian forces continued their offensive operations, and have made significant progress in three areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces broke through from Verbove to the village of Pryvillya. They moved downhill and southwest from the treelines on the tactical heights, establishing control over positions east of Pryvillya, before entering and capturing the village itself. Further east, they captured most of the rest of the tactical heights and began clearing more areas in the low-lying ground northwest of Novohryhorivka. 
To the northwest, after capturing Oleksiivka, Russian forces continued pushing through the treelines southeast of the village, and levelled the frontline towards the southern bank of the Vovcha River. They also began advancing up the treelines west of Sosnivka, attempting to reach the intersection of the Vovcha and Vorona Rivers. 
Further east, Russian forces were able to re-enter the village of Novoselivka. They established control over the northern part and are now engaged in fierce fighting for the southern streets. 
+ ~39.69 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
A short time ago, one Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile launched from near Bryansk City impacted the vicinity of Koryukivka, Chernihiv Oblast.

High-resolution satellite imagery published by Ukrainian outlet Radio Svoboda of the Feodosia Oil Depot in Crimea shows the extent of the damage from repeated Ukrainian UAV attacks. 
As a result of the recent attacks on October 7 and October 13, 11 oil tanks were destroyed and 4 others sustained varying levels of damage.

Russian Army Advances Deeper In Kupyansk, Captures Two More Settlements In Kharkiv (Videos) 
On October 17, the Russian military advanced deeper into the city of Kupyansk and imposed control over two other settlements elsewhere in the Kharkiv direction.
The Zapad [West] Group of Forces has reportedly imposed control of all the areas to the north of Kuznechnaya street in the center of Kupyansk following fierce clashes with Kiev forces.
In addition to ongoing operations in Kupyansk, the Zapad Group of Forces continues to advance in the pocket to the east of the Oskil River, between the city and Kolisnykivka.

Russian Troops Capture Pryvillya After Successful Breakthrough In Dnepropetrovsk
On October 17, Russian military‚Äôs Vostok [East] Group of Forces captured Pryvillya after successfully breaking through Ukrainian defenses in the Dnepropetrovsk once again.
The capture of Pryvillya, which is located along the Yanchur River, was confirmed by the Russian Ministry of Defense. Russian troops advanced more than five kilometers from Verbove to reach the settlement, capturing a large area on the way.
The next step by the Vostok Group of Forces will likely be an attack on Vyshneve to the north. Russian troops have been advancing towards the eastern outskirts of the settlement from Verbove.

Air Defenses And Drones: New Report Reveals Turkish Plan To Arm Syria
Turkey is planning to arm Syria‚Äôs new military with advanced weapons, including armored vehicles, drones, artillery, missiles, and air defense systems, in the coming weeks, Bloomberg, reported on October 17, citing Turkish officials.
The officials told the news outlet that the weapons will be deployed in northern Syria to avoid any tensions with Israel in the south. They noted that this plan is part of broader understandings with Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government to support efforts to rebuild the Syrian military.

Iran Is Digging Up One Of Its Nuclear Sites, Israel Could Use This As Pretext To Attack 
The Institute for Science and International Security (ISIS) reported activities at one of Iran‚Äôs most secretive nuclear sites, citing satellite images from Maxar, Vantor, and Airbus which were taken between the end of September and early October.
In a report published on October 16, the Washington-based institute said that the middle of three entrances at Isfahan Nuclear Technology Research Center, which were previously blocked by earth and rubble, had been cleared leaving the tunnel portal‚Äôs door visible as of September 26.

Heavy Urban Fighting: Russian Troops Are Advancing In Pokrovsk
Over 60% of the territory in the industrial zone of Pokrovsk is under the control of Russian forces. Russia's 47th Tank Division has taken control of the village of Peschanoye. 
President Donald Trump stated that delivering Tomahawk missiles could lead to an 'escalation', and that the US is not prepared to reduce its stockpile of these missiles.

Is Quad Group Dying Or Just Being Outsourced To Fight China?
The Quadrilateral Security Dialogue ‚Äî or ‚ÄúQuad‚Äù ‚Äî has long been hyped as the seeds of an ‚ÄúAsian NATO.‚Äù Made up of the US, Japan, India, and Australia, the Quad has been Washington‚Äôs big play for the Indo-Pacific. But with US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúAmerica First‚Äù approach, many are asking if the group has a future.
Squeezed by Trump‚Äôs neo-Monroeist foreign policy and his deal-making style with allies, QUAD is fading fast. Analysts such as Michael Shoebridge (Director of Strategic Analysis Australia) are¬†calling¬†it ‚Äúthe incredible shrinking Quad‚Äù: its July 2025 ministers‚Äô statement for instance boiled down to vague talk on sea security and cyber issues, ditching the meatier promises from Biden‚Äôs time.
Du Lan (Deputy Director at Asia-Pacific Institute) notes that Washington has ‚Äúconcentrated mostly on domestic reforms and ending conflicts in Ukraine and the Middle East conflict‚Äù...
